taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

taxonConcepts.scientificName: Amblydoras hancockii (Valenciennes in Cuvier and Valenciennes, 1840)
Amblydoras hancockii (Valenciennes in Cuvier and Valenciennes, 1840)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs in freshwater coastal swamps and the flood-prone zones of rivers.  Gregarious, lives schools which may consist of several hundred fish.  Hides under roots, leaves or stocks.  Is known to build a nest of bubbles at the surface, defended by the males as the 'Atipas' do.  In case of drought, it is reputed to being very resistant and to crawl in search of a new swamp while holding some water in its ears.  Feeds on algae and debris (Ref. 35381).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: South America:  Guyana and eastern Brazil to Peru and Bolivia.
dataObjects.references: Robins, C.R., R.M. Bailey, C.E. Bond, J.R. Brooker, E.A. Lachner, R.N. Lea and W.B. Scott 1991 World fishes important to North Americans. Exclusive of species from the continental waters of the United States and Canada. Am. Fish. Soc. Spec. Publ. (21):243 p. (Ref. 4537)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Upper Orinoco, Negro, Essequibo and Demerara drainages: Brazil, Colombia, Guyana, Venezuela.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.description: Dorsal spines (total): 1; Dorsal soft rays (total): 6; Analsoft rays: 11 - 13

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: The body is a little elongated, without scales but with a lateral range of 24 to 28 bony plaque.  Head is large and rounded.  Mouth is nearly terminal and has three pairs of barbels (Ref. 35381).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: demersal; freshwater; pH range: 6.0 - 8.0; dH range: 5 - 19

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#LifeCycle
dataObjects.description: Builds a bubble nest with small parts of water plants under the surface. The male guards the nest (Ref. 1672).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Uses
dataObjects.title: Importance
dataObjects.description: fisheries: of no interest; aquarium: commercial
